data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: First, good review for our waiter. He was nice. Lady at bar was pleasant. Do not order ribs because you will get the end that has fat and meat is stringy oh and chewy.  Kat the manager came out and explained that is how they serve it so you will get an end of the slab. She has never had any complaints. Offered me something else or reduce tab. Her attitude was disgusting and gave me a fake smile. The smile was a gesture of sarcasm which was deplorable to be a manager. She took half off the price. Probably reluctantly. Lol

data.title: Romantic Setting...Great Food
data.text: The food was very good in this quiet romantic setting beside the pond in Oyster Point. The waitress was very good and making sure our table had everything that we needed. The special flounder was seasoned and cooked just right. There cheeseburger was huge and delicious. The atmosphere and décor was relaxing and attractive. Will go back again when in the area. They also have a nice bar selection.

data.title: Conveniently located across the pond from the Marriott
data.text:
We visited here while touring Newport News. There were five of us, and all had great meals while holding a quick meeting. 

The She Crab Soup was wonderful, with much more crab than you usually find in this dish. (Just $4 !)

I had the Seafood Stack, which consists of a perfectly seasoned and grilled whole flounder filet topped with a more-than-generous pile of delicious lump crabmeat. It's nicely dressed with a unique sherry basil cream sauce; sides are creamy, tasty garlic mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus. ($19.49)

High ceilings and nicely spaced tables let you have privacy and reasonable sound level. There are outside tables. 

The online menu (http://www.covetavern.com/food-menu) pops up detailed chef descriptions of each dish by rolling your mouse over the items.

data.title: Good view & drinks.
data.text: The restaurant has a lovely view & wonderful drinks. Sadly, the food was rather average with other like places, & did not leave as much of an impression as I would have hoped.

data.title: Dinner out.
data.text: I read about this restaurant on line. It was directly across from the hotel. It's a nice place. I ordered the ribs on the recommendation of the waiter. They looked very good as you can see from the picture below. However they were incredibly salty, to the point of not being edible. The waiter took them away and they didn't appear on the bill. The apple cobbler was excellent. The people I was dining with had very good meals. I think mine was more of a fluke than the norm.

data.title: Excellent service.  Good food.
data.text: I went for the $6 burger night, not a specialty dish.  Beer and burgers. All great.  The service was excellent; friendly, helpful, and attentive. Easy atmosphere to relax, laugh, and enjoy yourself.

data.title: Great shrimp
data.text: Initially ate here simply due to the proximity to the hotel.  Went back for the shrimp skillet, the margaritas and the service.  I didn't have any of the entrees.  The shrimp skillet appetizer was plenty for me.  Great outside dining.  Affordable.

data.title: Definitely worth a try if you are visiting Newport News
data.text: My son and I ate there while he attended a sports camp. Food was quick and good. Service was terrific. Friendly "bar" atmosphere that is fine for families.

data.title: Excellent bar and food.
data.text: I was on my own, on business, and wanted something to eat.  The bar is very nice and the staff were very friendly.  I had a burrito, which was delicious, but big enough for two people.  When the bill came I was very pleasantly surprised.  I would recommend this tavern

data.title: Nice local spot, but not worth a special trip, need better trained bartender
data.text:
My mother and I visited for dinner.  The restaurant is on the loud side. The food was good, but not really memorable.

I asked for a martini straight up and was given warm gin and vermouth in a small rocks glass -- as if I had asked for whiskey neat.

If I lived in the area, I could see coming here occasionally.  But not worth a trip across town

data.title: We wanted take out
data.text: We decided to get take out..This was our first experience there and it was a good one. The price was reasonable and the food was good. There was no problems and the place is by a beautiful fountain.

data.title: The best!
data.text: One of the best olaces to go for good drinks, food and a chill atmosphere.  Excellent drink specials, very clean and wonderful staff.

data.title: Nice setting
data.text: This was centrally located to the Marriott we were staying at on the lake (pond).  Service was good, place very nice.  TV's everywhere.  Food was decent.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Had lunch because a good friend recommended this place.  It was pretty good.  Outside seating was nice on the patio with a view of the fountain.  The start was bumpy because the hostess seated us at a table where the patio umbrella was not in working order.  My party decided to move to a different table.  Service was so-so, but the waitress mentioned that she was the only server on duty at the time.  I was disappointed that there was no cornbread (an item many rave about).  The server said it wouldn't be ready and it would not be served with our meal.  I might go again at a different time just to see if my experience will be better.

data.title: Service was POOR from the time we entered the Tavern
data.text:
Unfortunately, I was deterred from eating at the Cove after my encounter with two of the employees.  

Upon our arrival their was no host/hostess around, so we asked another worker (not sure of his position) how seating worked during happy hour.  He acted if he had no clue and didn't bother to find out.  After we were finally seated in the bar area, I asked the sever if we could order from the happy hour menu from the booth we were seated, she stated something along the lines that she didn't know the happy hour policy and she only worked in the one area.  At this point, I was extremely confused.  When she finally told us about the drink specials and my friend decided to consider ordering a drink special at 5:55 pm, she stated something along the lines of not losing her job, as the special didn't start until 6pm.  At this point, the whole experience was a little much to me.  Everyone seemed very careless and matter of fact.  Thus, I decided that the lack of professionalism and attitude of the staff was not worth the expense or risk. In my opinion the sever is a reflection of the restaurant and sometime speak to the quality of food you will receive. She even used some slang when attempting to place our order.  Overall, I don't know why people feel so comfortable in the work place these day's will dealing the customers.    Nevertheless, I didn't have the opportunity to taste the food, as I decide to dine somewhere else that ended up being amazing Travinia Italian Kitchen.

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: I visited The Cove Tavern for lunch with a group of colleagues while attending a conference nearby.  We were seated immediately and had an attentive waiter.  The decor was pleasant.  I ordered the Cuban and was a bit underwhelmed.  The bread was nice and chewy, and the meats tasted fresh, but it just seemed to lack a little punch.  Others had hamburgers and were pleased with their meals.

data.title: Great Mother's Day buffet
data.text: There was an outstanding selection of foods, including a carving station.  The crab cakes were worth the money by themselves. Meats galore.  Everything prepared top notch. The Cove only succeeded in proving they should have a brunch every weekend.  I know I'd be a regular if they did.

data.title: Wasted
data.text: I called for carry out since I live nearby. The place was packed. I had given them the time they asked me to wait to come and my food still wasn't ready. We had the chicken and waffle, the shrimp, a sandwich. Of course, my food was the order they would get wrong. The sweet potato fries were good. The place is pricey to me. But I guess the location allows for it. The soup was a thick glob of i don't know what. So, I might try them again, but I will avoid the shrimp and soup. Oh and the waffle and fried chicken.

data.title: Great experience
data.text: From beginning to end...Everything just worked! The hostess asked us about our day and actually waited for a response; the greeting had the genuine feel! The waitress, Valencia, was best of all! You get the impression immediately that she likes her job and believes in her "product" or she is simply professional. Whatever it is, it works! She made a recommendation to my husband who simply could not make up his mind and it was absolutely perfect! For the food to live up to the hype would have been a challenge...well, our meal at The Cove lived up to it ...and then some! From the location, atmosphere to the lovely Valencia, it was a great experience that we look forward to repeating! As we were leaving, live music was just getting set-up...so I guess this place really does have it all!

data.title: What A Wonderful Time!
data.text:
We ate with another couple and had dinner and drinks. Just catching up. We got there about 7:00 or so and it was not overly busy yet. Our server was new but bright, bubbly, friendly and helpful. We did not mind that she didn't know the beer menu yet!  

Our drinks were delicious (try the X rated Margarita! I have no idea why it's X rated but it was excellent!) and the food was great! Prices were reasonable and our setting and ambiance was very nice too. The restaurant is beside the City Center Fountains and it's so pretty there. There was a fireplace going (chilly evening) and the lighting in the restaurant was low key and perfect. 

We had been once before with family and he hadn't gone again ever. I'm glad we tried again and loved our evening there. 

I had the Cuban, someone else had the Seafood Stack, an abundant and gorgeous looking salad, and though I can't remember the name of the fourth dinner, it looked amazing just in presentation. 

Overall, definitely recommend!! Great service, wonderful food, drinks were perfect and the atmosphere in the restaurant was on point.  Will make for a great memory!!!
